basics.name: Aman Raghu Malali
basics.label: MS/PhD Student, Computer Science
basics.summary: MS/PhD student at UMass Amherst building reliable MLOps pipelines for models in production, with a focus on monitoring, failure prediction, and cost-aware, drift-triggered retraining. Current projects include coreset selection for rapid retraining and efficient LLM fine-tuning as user queries evolve under drift.

work.name: University of Massachusetts Amherst — DREAM Lab
work.summary: Predictive machine learning (ML) model maintenance in production settings.
highlights: Built an uncertainty-aware ensemble metamodel that forecasts deployed ML model performance without ground truth and tracks data drift’s direct impact on loss.
Developed a predictive retraining orchestrator that retrains only when needed based on performance forecasts, minimizing downtime, reducing drift-induced errors, and lowering compute costs.

work.name: Dolby Advanced Technology Group (ATG)
work.summary: Extended and improved predictive ML model maintenance.
highlights: Developed a feature-based temperature scaling technique with a novel calibration loss that calibrates both probabilities and uncertainty under drift, improving prediction reliability.
Expanded predictive maintenance by incorporating granular loss levels and adaptive loss bounds to optimize retraining decisions; explored extensions for concept drift.

work.name: Robert Bosch Center for Cyber Physical Systems & ArtPark, IISc (Aham Avatar XPRIZE Team)
work.summary: Telepresence robotics R&D for the ANA Avatar XPRIZE.
highlights: Led design and development of a multi-robot telepresence system controllable via a low-latency web interface.
Built a motion-tracking framework to map human arm poses to dual 7-DoF robotic arms via inverse kinematics.
Team achieved Semifinalist status in the $10M ANA Avatar XPRIZE.

publications.summary: Malali, A., Hiriyannaiah, S., Siddesh, G. M., Srinivasa, K. G., & Sanjay, N. T. (2020). Supervised ECG wave segmentation using convolutional LSTM. ICT Express, 6(3), 166–169.

projects.name: Perceptually guided zero-shot saliency for scalable visualization
projects.summary: Training-free saliency leveraging multi-layer activations from pretrained foundation vision models to approximate human perception and drive adaptive downsampling of large scatter plots, preserving salient structure while reducing render cost.

projects.name: NeuralGLAZE: Noise generation for artwork using neural networks
projects.summary: Single-pass, perception-aware (LPIPS) noise generator that keeps images visually unchanged to humans while making artworks unusable to image classifiers—achieving modest performance at significantly lower computational cost compared to GLAZE.
